timeline.bodyText:
As per LSP spec, after this call no other service call can/should be handled. Should we have a logic to return no-valid from all our service after this call is made.
Why I didn't implement it?
VScode actually never waits for us to call exit. Upon closing, it fires a shutdown call and then fires an exit call.
Details mentioned in the PR comment.
timeline.author: ap891843

replies.bodyText: We support different IDEs, should it would be better not to rely on the client implementation
replies.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText:
I spent major time here. Using interceptor actually leads to some proxy classes and it seems without this annotation here, this method is marked final which leads to error while spying. I get the below error

java.lang.VerifyError: class com.broadcom.lsp.cobol.service.CobolTextDocumentService$$EnhancerByGuice$$c86ee31e$MockitoMock$565924183 overrides final method com.broadcom.lsp.cobol.service.CobolTextDocumentService$$EnhancerByGuice$$c86ee31e.observerCallback(Ljava/lang/Object;)

This confuses me if guice interceptors are the right approach.  This is a question to all reviewers, if you feel the same , I will re-work this with some other approach.
For now, I have kept this annotation as is.
replies.author: ap891843

replies.bodyText: It deserves some further investigation, but ok, let's leave the annotation there.

timeline.bodyText:
You don't really need to resolve this future asynchronously. Please, use this instead:
return CompletableFuture.completedFuture(SHUTDOWN_RESPONSE);
timeline.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: You can use CompletableFuture.completedFuture in both returns.
timeline.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: It makes sense to update exitCode after successfully done the cancelAllProcessing call.

replies.bodyText: But in this case, we still have a separate executor for LSP4J and another one for the data bus and other stuff, right?
replies.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText:
Yes, LSP4J uses a new cached thread pool for its use, if we don't provide (it creates using Executors.newCachedThreadPool()).
And our process will use the custom thread pool (dataBus/ textDocumnetService etc).
replies.author: ap891843

timeline.bodyText: Should we shutdown also the scheduled pool here?
timeline.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Optional: this name seems very wordy, especially on the usages. Maybe, executors would be enough?

+package com.broadcom.lsp.cobol.core.annotation;
+
+import com.google.inject.matcher.AbstractMatcher;
+
+import java.lang.reflect.Method;
+
+/**
+ * Custom {@link com.google.inject.matcher.Matcher} to identify any synthetic method and returns
+ * false if the method is synthetic
+ */
+public class NonSyntheticMethodMatcher extends AbstractMatcher<Method> {
+
+  /**
+   * match any synthetic method and returns false if the method is synthetic
+   *
+   * @param method
+   * @return true if method is non-synthetic and false otherwise
+   */
+  @Override
+  public boolean matches(Method method) {
+    return !method.isSynthetic();
